shortdesc.ph: Stops the media stream relay across channels. Once stopped, the broadcaster leaves all destination channels.
Stops the media stream relay across channels. Once stopped, the host leaves all destination channels.
Stops cross-channel media stream relay. Once stopped, the broadcaster leaves all destination channels.
Stops cross-channel media stream forwarding. Once stopped, the host leaves all destination channels.

section.p: After a successful call, the SDK triggers the callback. If it reports RelayStateIdle (0) and RelayOk (0), it indicates that the media stream relay has stopped.
After a successful call, the SDK triggers the callback. If it reports RelayStateIdle (0) and RelayOk (0), it indicates that the media stream relay has stopped.
After the method is successfully called, the SDK triggers the callback. If it reports relayStateIdle (0) and relayOk (0), it indicates that media stream relay has been stopped.
After a successful call to this method, the SDK triggers the callback. If it reports RELAY_STATE_IDLE (0) and RELAY_OK (0), it indicates that media stream forwarding has stopped.
section.note: If the method call fails, the SDK triggers the callback and reports the error code RelayErrorServerNoResponse (2) or RelayErrorServerConnectionLost (8). You can call the method to leave the channel, and the media stream relay will stop automatically.

If the method call fails, the SDK triggers the callback and reports error codes RelayErrorServerNoResponse (2) or RelayErrorServerConnectionLost (8). You can call the method to leave the channel, and the media stream relay will automatically stop.

If the method call fails, the SDK triggers the callback and reports the status code relayErrorServerNoResponse (2) or relayErrorServerConnectionLost (8). You can call the method to leave the channel, and the cross-channel media stream relay will stop automatically.

If the method call fails, the SDK will trigger the callback and report the status code RELAY_ERROR_SERVER_NO_RESPONSE (2) or RELAY_ERROR_SERVER_CONNECTION_LOST (8). You can call the method to leave the channel, and cross-channel media stream forwarding will stop automatically.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li:
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and troubleshooting.
-5: The method call is rejected. There is no ongoing media stream relay.

< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and troubleshooting.
-5: The method call is rejected. There is no ongoing media stream relay across channels.

section.p:
When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Method call failed. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
-5: This method call was rejected. There is no ongoing cross-channel media stream relay.

ul.li:
< 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
-5: This method call was rejected. No cross-channel media stream forwarding is currently in progress.
